title: Urine Tests
author: R. Morgan Griffin

sections.heading: Who Gets the Test?
content: All women get urine tests during pregnancy. You might get the test during each doctor's visit. Urine tests are a standard way of checking on your health.

content_blocks.text: All women get urine tests during pregnancy. You might get the test during each doctor's visit. Urine tests are a standard way of checking on your health.

sections.heading: What the Test Does
content: Urine tests check levels of protein, glucose, and blood as well as identify signs of infection. Unusual urine tests can be a sign of problems, such as diabetes, preeclampsia (high blood pressure), or kidney and bladder infection . All of these conditions are treatable. Urine tests won't tell you anything specific about your baby's health.

content_blocks.text: Urine tests check levels of protein, glucose, and blood as well as identify signs of infection. Unusual urine tests can be a sign of problems, such as diabetes, preeclampsia (high blood pressure), or kidney and bladder infection . All of these conditions are treatable. Urine tests won't tell you anything specific about your baby's health.

sections.heading: How the Test Is Done
content: You'll urinate into a sterile cup. Your doctor will send it to a lab for testing.

content_blocks.text: You'll urinate into a sterile cup. Your doctor will send it to a lab for testing.

sections.heading: What to Know About Test Results
content: If any of your test results are unusual, don't worry. That doesn't necessarily mean there's a problem. Many women have occasional high glucose levels , for instance.
Your doctor will probably suggest follow-up tests. If there is a problem, treatment will help keep you and your baby healthy.

content_blocks.text: If any of your test results are unusual, don't worry. That doesn't necessarily mean there's a problem. Many women have occasional high glucose levels , for instance.
Your doctor will probably suggest follow-up tests. If there is a problem, treatment will help keep you and your baby healthy.

sections.heading: How Often the Test Is Done During Your Pregnancy
content: You'll get a urine test on your first prenatal visit. Your doctor will do further tests, typically at every test.

content_blocks.text: You'll get a urine test on your first prenatal visit. Your doctor will do further tests, typically at every test.

sources: American Congress of Obstetricians and Gynecologists: "Routine Tests in Pregnancy."
Johns Hopkins Manual of Gynecology and Obstetrics , 4 th Edition. Lippincott Williams & Williams, 2010..
